title: Business & Finance
text:
The supply-chain disruptions rippling across the business world are taking a heavy toll on small U.S. firms, which have fewer resources to absorb or push back on price increases.

---

Credit Suisse amassed over $20 billion of exposure to investments related to Archegos, but struggled to monitor them before the fund was forced to liquidate many of its large positions.

---

Shares of UiPath rose 23% in their market debut, giving the automation software maker a valuation of roughly $36 billion.

---

Ford is planning more downtime at five North American factories due to a global chip shortage, further disrupting output of a popular SUV and the F-150 pickup truck.

---

Tesla, hit by a widespread outcry over its handling of consumer complaints in China, publicly apologized and pledged to set up a customer-satisfaction unit.

---

U.S. stocks rose, with the Dow and S&P 500 both gaining 0.9% and the Nasdaq adding 1.2%.

---

Hertz agreed to provide some value to equity holders when the rental-car company leaves chapter 11.

---

Walmart is phasing out the hulking automated pickup towers that were erected in more than 1,500 stores.
